content:
If you are asking about a No Objection Certificate (NOC) for an employee to leave a company, it is typically a letter issued by the employer stating that they have no objection to the employee leaving the company for a specified reason. The letter usually contains the following information:

1. Employee's name and designation.
2. Reason for leaving the company.
3. Date of termination of employment or last working day.
4. Any pending dues to be paid to the employee.
5. Confirmation that the employee has returned all company property, if applicable.
6. Signature of the authorized person from the company.

The format and wording of the NOC may vary depending on the company's policies and the reason for the employee leaving. It is best to consult with the HR department or the employee's supervisor to obtain the correct format and details for the NOC.
